title: Style influencer? Jeff Bezos's favorite Vilebrequin swim trunks sell out
text:
Amazon founder and CEO Jeff Bezos undoubtedly has plenty of influence, including on the way people buy things like clothing and swimwear.

But in a surprising development, it turns out that the 55-year-old's sway on those purchases may come down to more than just algorithms.

This summer, Bezos was photographed on multiple occasions wearing the same pair of $230 Vilebrequin Blue Okoa Octopus Swim Trunks — and according to GQ, they've now completely sold out.

Faves: Amazon founder and CEO Jeff Bezos was spotted wearing the same swim trunks several times this summer (pictured with girlfriend Lauren Sanchez in St Tropez in August)

Staple: The 55-year-old billionaire even wore the $230 shorts with the same blue shirt more than once in St Tropez

Bezos spent time yachting all over Europe this summer alongside girlfriend Lauren Sanchez.

The pair traveled on David Geffen's and Barry Diller's yacht and were seen around Venice and Saint Tropez.

And on at least three occasions, he was snapped in the same pair of blue Vilebrequin swim trunks with a purple octopus print.

'The richest man in the world keeps wearing the same pair of swim trunks,' wrote the New York Post in August.

'I have reason to believe that the richest man on earth, creator of Amazon, only has one pair of swimming trunks,' wrote Celebuzz.

A quick Google search shows that these particular swim trunks are now sold out everywhere online, including the brand's own site, Bloomingdale's, and Amazon.

Similar styles are still available, but this colorway of the octopus print is gone.

According too the fashion search engine Lyst, there was a huge spike in interest for the swim trunks this summer. From July to September, they were 4,000 times more searched-for, and the brand was 105 per cent more visited overall during the same period.

Trend-setter: The $230 Vilebrequin Blue Okoa Octopus Swim Trunks have now sold out, and Lyst reports there was a huge spike in searched for them this summer

Uniform: He was also seen wearing them on David Geffe's yacht (pictured front right)

Lyst even ranked the item number nine on its Q3 2019 Hottest Men's Products list, where they shared space with a Gucci leather belt, Air Jordans, a Vetements embroidered cap, and Adidas by Raf Simons Ozweego sneakers.

It's not the first time Bezos' fashion 'influence' has been considered: In August 2018, the New York Times published a piece called Jeff Bezos, Style icon.

'He is doing something with style that differentiates him from any one else in tech,' Joseph Rosenfeld, a personal style adviser who specializes in the tech world, told the publication.

'We have seen him sharpen up, with a wardrobe rooted in tradition but also very modernist and minimal. It creates a focus on him, and has evolved in accordance with his business.'

Earlier this month, the mogul was named America's richest businessman by Forbes, which estimates that he is worth $114 billion.

His ex-wife, Mackenzie Bezos, made her debut on the list this year thanks to their divorce settlement, leaving her with $36.1 billion and the number 15 spot on the Forbes 400.

The Amazon founder narrowly beat number two on the list, Bill Gates, who has $114 billion, which is down from his 2017 fortune of $160 billion.

Also in the top 10 are Warren Buffett, Mark Zuckerberg, Larry Page, Sergey Brin, and Michael Bloomberg.
